loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a single woman with two school-going children. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

For the past one year, she has operated a beauty salon business. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a challenge of seasonality.
 
With the 25,000 KES, she wants to purchase manicure and pedicure supplies, facial kit, relaxing chemicals, shampoo and hair food. She decided to join Yehu because of favorable loaning requirements.

loans.use: to purchase manicure and pedicure supplies, facial kit, relaxing chemicals, shampoo and hair food

loans.name: Los Claveles De Poques Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal LOS CLAVELES DE POQUES, el banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Poques, distrito de Lamay, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Luisa Juana tiene 46 años de edad y es separada, la socia altera sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la crianza y engorde de animales como ganados, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a esta actividad la cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a sus vacas para luego venderlas  a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y desea poder seguir trabajando en su negocio para de esta forma apoyar a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos para sus animales.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank Los Claveles de Poques (The Carnations of Poques). This bank is located in the community of Poques, Lamay district, Calca province, and department of Cusco.  

The member Luisa Juana is 46 years old and is separated. She alternates her daily activities between raising and feeding animals such as cows. She works a good amount of time at this job which is going well thanks to the hard work that she puts in each day. She raises cattle in order to later to clients who order them. She is a responsible person and wants to be able to continue working in her business in order to support her family. 

She’s asking for a loan to buy feed for her animals. 

She feels grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the terms.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
Asunta continua con la agricultura entonces ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra  maíz, papas, cebada, trigo y otros productos secos, ella continua con la venta de productos secos y con llevar sus productos a las ciudades de Challabamba y Cusco. 

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para la tierra de cultivo. Ella está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.

Asunta nació en la ciudad de Calca, pero vive en la comunidad Jajahuana (esta comunidad se encuentra en el distrito de Challabamba, dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo y el departamento de Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 58 años, es casada y tiene seis hijos. Ella pertenece a Santa Isabel de Jajahuana Banco Comunal y sus principales actividades económicas son la agricultura y la ganadería.
texts.en:
Asunta still works in agriculture. She has several fields where she grows corn, potatoes, barley, wheat, and other dry goods. She still sells her products and brings them to the cities of Challabamba and Cusco. 

Currently she needs a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer in order to grow crops. She’s happy to get the loan and promises to make prompt payments. 

Asunta was born in the city of Calca, but she lives in the town of Jajahuana (which is the in the Challabamba district, in the middle of the Paucartambo province and the department of Cusco, Peru).  She’s 56 years old and married with six children. She belongs to the Santa Isabel de Jajahuana Banco Comunal (Santa Isabel de Jajahuana Communal Bank). Her main economic activities are agriculture and raising animals.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of rice porridge and bread, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand

loans.name: Debner

texts.es: Debner, de 53 años de edad, está casado con Daysi quien es ama de casa y madre de sus hijos. Juntos habitan la casa de sus padres en compañía de su papá, su hermana y sus dos sobrinos. Debner se dedica al transporte público, para eso cuenta con 2 mototaxis que compró con su propio capital. Hace 5 años que viene realizando este oficio, recorriendo las calles de la ciudad en busca de sus clientes a los que brinda su servicio de manera amable, cordial y llevándolos a su destino de manera segura. Un vehículo es conducido por él mismo mientras que otro lo alquila diariamente a un chofer de su barrio a cambio de un pago fijo que recibe al terminar la jornada laboral. Le gusta su trabajo pues le brinda los ingresos económicos que necesita, además esta labor le permite tener un oficio ya que no conseguía ningún empleo y ahora trabaja de manera independiente. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda de transporte público en la ciudad. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, por tanto se siente agradecido con todas las personas que le brindan el préstamo que necesita para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará repuestos como llantas, sistema de arrastre y pagará el servicio del mecánico por la refacción de su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Debner is 53 years old and is married to Daysi, who is a housewife and the mother of their children. They live together in the house of her parents, together with her father, sister and two cousins.

Debner has a public transport business. He owns 2 motorcycle taxis that he paid with his own money. He has been in this line of business for 5 years, traversing the city streets looking for customers, whom he serves kindly, cordially and taking them to their destination in a safe way. One vehicle is driven by him, while the other is leased to a driver in his neighbourhood who gives him a fixed payment at the end of the working day. He likes his job since it brings him the income he needs. He is also happy to have work, which he had previously difficulty finding, and likes to work independently. His work is quite profitable due to the high demand of public transport in the city.

In this opportunity he is requesting PEN 2000, and he is thankful to all lenders who are helping him reach his objectives. He commits to paying it back precisely in time. With the amount requested he will buy spare parts, such as tires and a traction system, as well as pay the mechanic for other parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts, such as tires and a traction system, as well as paying the mechanic.

loans.name: Fely Conchita

texts.en:
Fely Conchita, 49 years old, is married and they are blessed with four children. She has managed a hog raising business for almost 15 years, and she's earning a net income of 3,000 PHP per hog when she sells.

Due to a lack of capital, she wants to avail herself of a loan amounting to 15,000 PHP to purchase hog feed for her hogs. She's hoping that her hog raising business will continue to grow so that her business will become more productive.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed for her hogs

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Juana, requiere de un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para continuar con la venta de productos de uso personal y mariscos, asimismo con ello lograr obtener mejores ingresos; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar, talcos, desodorantes, lociones, cremas, también pescado, camarones, entre otros. 
Cuenta la Sra. Juana que el crédito anterior le ayudo de manera favorable, porque logro establecer bien su negocio de venta de mariscos y ampliar las ventas. Su deseo es tener su propio local, agregar otro tipo de  productos y generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana requires a new loan because she needs more working capital to continue with the sale of personal use products and seafood and thus obtain better earnings. This investment will help her to buy powders, deodorants, lotions, creams, and also fish, shrimp and other items.

Juana says that the previous loan helped in her a favorable manner, because she was able to establish her seafood sales business well and expand sales. Her wish is to have her own store, to add other types of products and to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy powders, deodorants, lotions, creams, and also fish, shrimp and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente vive en casa propia con su madre y su esposa, él se dedica a la venta de pescado desde hace 2 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela por que su mercaderia es fresca  y a buen precio, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar mas pescado por mayor y una hielera donde guarda su mercaderia, para poder seguir con su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client lives in his own house with his mother and his wife.  He has been selling fish for two years.  He has his business at his house.  He has a lot of clientele because his merchandise is fresh and at a good price.  With the earnings that he gets from his sales he manages to pay some of the household expenses.

The client is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy more fish wholesale and to buy a cooler where he can keep his merchandise.  He will do this to be able to continue with his business, to get better earnings, and to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cooler and to buy fish wholesale.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a housewife. She is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC for her husband's work. He sell embroidery materials in the market to fulfill household needs. His net income is too low to save even a single penny. Even providing basic needs to her family presents many hurdles and challenges. Samina is a mother of six children, and three of their sons are doing small jobs. They are living in a small house with huge family.

Samina's husband needs the loan amount to purchase embroidery materials including threads, buttons, laces and ribbons. Therefore his wife has requested a loan so that she can help him in purchasing the needful things. This is very important for him to continue his work. She hopes that the loan will be good for her husband's work. She promises to pay back the loan amount on time. She says hello to all Kiva lenders, and asks them to pray for her children's bright future.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery materials including threads, buttons and ribbons.

loans.name: Kalerwe Tulla- Habib Group

texts.en:
Habib is a 37-years-old resident of Kalwere. He is married with three children. However, he also takes care of two widows and their children by providing them with basic needs, since they lost their husbands who were responsible for taking care of them.

Habib drives a taxi to earn a living. He started this job in 2003 after failing to find formal employment, yet still needing to meet the growing needs of his family. Habib mostly deals in town transportation service.

His dream is to have another taxi so that he can earn higher wages. This would help him provide the best for his family and many dependents.

His major challenge is lack of enough money to purchase a taxi, therefore he needs a loan to help him purchase a taxi. Habib is very hardworking and honest according to his colleagues. He will use the loan to purchase a taxi for himself.

Habib confided that if he had enough funds, he would quit being a taxi driver and settle down as a businessman. However, he thanks UGAFODE for giving them loans at reduced rates.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand taxi

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en: Pilar, 49 years old, is married. She and her husband are blessed with three school-aged children. They live in the mountainous region of Isabela Province. Pilar has raised hogs for 10 years, and she wants to expand her piggery. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy vitamins and feeds for her business. She hopes that she can provide a quality living for her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feeds for her hogs

loans.name: Sonia Estela

texts.es: Sonia de 43 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene 2 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Sonia, age 43, is a single mother.  She lives with her two children in her own house.  She has a store where she sells basic needs items, beans, milk, eggs, and bread, among others.  She has had her business for two years, and it has gifted her with sales experience that allows her to get the best profits.  The business is located at her home in a very busy place.  It is well-known by the neighbors in the area.  She has made a lot of customers as she has the store stocked.

She wants to increase her business and make a new investment.  However she needs capital.  That is why she is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy what she needs for her store.  She affirms that she will repay the debt, and she trusts that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, milk, eggs, bread, and soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Joyet

texts.en:
Joyet is a married woman with three children. She is 40 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Joyet has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. 

Joyet has been in this business for 13 years. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more provisions, indirectly helping to boost her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more provisions, helping her boost overall sales.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José, le surge la necesidad de adquirir un nuevo préstamo porque necesita dinero para iniciar la siembra de granos básicos; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los insumos agrícolas, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le permitió aumentar sus ingresos, cosechas y de las ganancias logro comprar dos terneros para engordarlos y luego venderlos. Gracias a esta inversión las condiciones económicas han mejorado, mantiene el mismo grupo familiar y están muy bien de salud.
texts.en:
José needs a new loan because he needs money to start growing basic grains.  The investment will help him buy soil amendments, herbicide, pesticide, insecticide, and other agricultural inputs.

The previous loan allowed him to increase his income and harvests.  With his profits he managed to buy two calves to fatten and sell.  Thanks to this investment his economic situation has improved.  He supports the same family group and they're all very healthy.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a single woman with no children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself. 

Rehema sells cooked food from her home to the general public. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the requested loan of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase foodstuffs such as maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is a housewife. She is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC to help support her husband's work. He owns a garment shop in the market. He has excellent tailoring skills so he stitches garments and sells dresses for a profit. His customers appreciate his work. 

Bushra is a responsible mother of three sons and five daughters. She is going through serious financial issues because it is so difficult to manage a large family these days. Her husband's income is too low as compared to the family's daily expenses.

Bushra is the group leader of a two-person lending group. Bushra's husband will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a variety of clothes for his business. By doing so, he will be able to continue his work and generate income, which is very important to sustain his family's living. Bushra is thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes for her husband's garment shop.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 39-year-old married woman with three children. 

Lilia has a small plantation and grows taro and banana crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Lilia has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, bush knives, file and barbed wire for her farming. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Lilia hopes to expand her plantation.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, bush knives, file and barbed wire

loans.name: Ahrorjon

texts.en:
Ahrorjon is a 40-year-old man. He is married and the father of two adult children. 

Ahrorjon has been busy with farming and animal husbandry for nine years. Thanks to his good experience in this field, he grows wheat and potatoes with a high degree of success. He also fattens cattle, but it brings in little income. It does not allow him to provide for the needs of his family and repair his house, because his family is large and needs a big and comfortable house. This year he is going to repair house with modern planning. His elder son wants to marry a lovely girl this year, and they will live in the house after it is repaired.

This loan will help him buy building materials to repair the house. In this way, he will provide a high quality living condition for his family and put an end to the problems with this house.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing his old house

loans.name: Developmental  Consideration2 Group

texts.en:
Justus is a second-time borrower in UGAFODE Microfinance Limited. His previous loan of UGX 500,000 was used for the purpose of repairing his fridge so that he could increase his sales in the shop. He runs a retail shop in the city outskirts, and he has borrowed a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to add more stock of soft drinks. Soft drinks are highly sought after, especially now that it is the dry season. 

Justus is a married man with two kids, one of whom goes to school. He has started up a small saloon to increase his income and also be able to save more. This helps him to improve his current standard of living and save for the future. He is planning to buy a piece of land and build a house for his family, reducing his rent expenses so as to increase his savings. He is so grateful to the funders for the great job they do of providing loans to low-income earners.

loans.use: To buy stock of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Hashim

texts.en:
Hashim is a 29-year-old married man and the father of three children. He has been working in the agricultural sector for 11 years. Hashim is a hard worker. He is specialized in growing palm trees and selling dates. Hashim takes good care of his farm and makes sure that every tree has the care it needs to ensure high quality production.

Hashim is requesting a loan of $3,000 US. He will use this loan to purchase fertilizers (mainly organic) and renovate the storage facility of his farm. Hashim expects that this loan will generate additional income that will enable him to buy livestock and develop his farm.

The story of Hashim and his business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development's clients who have been able to improve their business with a small business loan product, specifically designed to meet the needs of small businesses where a relatively small amount of capital can provide significant business improvement.

loans.use: to buy necessary fertilizers and renovate his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more provisions, helping her boost overall sales

loans.name: Maqsooda's Group

texts.en:
Maqsooda is the group leader of this three-person lending group. She is 34 years old and a very responsible woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. His income plays a vital role in fulfilling the family’s needs. He is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw is not working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income.

He wants to repair it as soon as possible so that he can continue generating income. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Maqsooda has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Maqsooda is so much thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 67 años, está casada y tiene 4 hijos pero vive con su esposo y su última hija en su casa propia. Yolanda se dedica a alquilar locales usados para negocios o actividades comerciales. Ha establecido en el frontis de su terreno dos locales que alquila mensualmente. Para la construcción de estos ambientes contó con el apoyo de su esposo, sus hijos y en ocasiones algunos obreros. Lleva en esta actividad más de 15 años. Actualmente se encuentra también en pleno acondicionamiento de habitaciones para alquiler y de esta forma generar otra fuente de ingresos económicos que le ayudan a solventar los gastos de su hogar. Le agrada su trabajo porque puede recibir ingresos diarios y buenas ganancias económicas sin que ella realice mucho esfuerzo y en la comodidad de su hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1200, por tanto agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para acceder al crédito que necesita para continuar con el logro de sus metas, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará pintura, brochas y renovará la cerradura del local que alquila.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 67 years old, is married and has four children, but she lives with her husband and their youngest daughter in a house they own. Yolanda makes a living from renting out spaces for businesses or commercial activities. She has established two spaces at the front of her land that she rents out on a monthly basis. 

For the construction of these spaces she counts on the support of her husband, her children and sometimes a few workers. She has had this business for more than fifteen years. She is currently also in the process of preparing rooms for rental and in this way she will generate another source of financial income to help cover her household expenses. She likes her work because she is able to receive daily income and good financial earnings without a lot of effort and from the comfort of her home.

At this time she is requesting 1200 Peruvian nuevos soles. She is grateful for the opportunity she is being given to access the loan that she needs to continue achieving her goals. She also pledges to make her payments in a punctual manner. With the requested amount, she will buy paint and brushes, and she will replace the lock on a space that she is renting out.

loans.use: to buy paint, brushes and a lock to renovate one of the spaces that she rents out.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru: Джумагул молодая замужняя женщина, проживающая в районе Дж.Руми. Ей 26 лет. Она является матерью двоих детей. Ее муж скотовод и земледелец. Он обеспечивает семью за счет дохода с этих деятельностей. Джумагул домохозяйка. Она умеет вышивать женские национальные платья. Теперь она хотела бы применить свои способности на деле. Но для этого ей нужна швейная машинка. С такой целью Джумагул обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить швейную машинку и начать собственное швейное дело. Джумагул хочет сама зарабатывать на жизнь и быть независимой женщиной. Швейный бизнес в их местности считается прибыльным бизнесом, так как сельские женщины предпочитают шить платья на заказ у портних. Джумагул планирует принимать заказы у себя дома. Прибыль с бизнеса она хочет потратить на улучшение быта.
texts.en:
Jumagul is a young and married woman, who is living in the J.Rumy region. She is 26 years old. She is the mother of two children. Her husband is a cattle breeder and farmer. He supports the family through the income from these activities. 

Jumagul is a housewife. She knows how to sew women's national dresses. Currently she would like to apply her skills in practice. But to do this she needs a sewing machine. With this aim, Jumagul applied for a loan, in order to purchase a sewing machine and start her own sewing business. Jumagul wants to earn money for living herself and to be an independent woman. 

The sewing business is a profitable business in their area, as the village women prefer to sew dresses on order from seamstresses. Jumagul plans to take orders at her home. She would like to spend the income from the business on improving everyday life.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine in order to start a sewing business

loans.name: Olinda Suyapa

texts.es:
Olinda es una joven de 27 años de edad, ama de casa y agricultora, casada y madre de 2 hijos los cuales viven juntos en familia. Tiene un grado de educación secundaria completa graduándose como perito mercantil y contador público pero no ejerce su profesión y su compañero de hogar trabaja emigro hace un tiempo hacia EE.UU para buscar una mejor condición de vida y poder ayudar a su pareja con los cultivos de café entre otros. Ella tiene un cultivo de café el cual hasta hoy en día al cual le ha dedicado 3 años de trabajo siendo sus padres y su compañero de hogar estando en honduras los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra. En sus cultivos solo se involucra ella y sus suegros para dar mantenimiento y asistencia a sus cultivos como: limpieza, abono, fertilización y en temporada la parte de recolección. 

Olinda hoy en día está solicitando ayuda para compra de fertilizante, abono, urea foliares entre otros para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, mismo que si no se le da mantenimiento y cuidado a tiempo puede ser dañado por la roya.

Ella sueña con educar a sus hijos para que tenga una mejor calidad de vida, mejores oportunidades de empleo y un mejor desarrollo en la sociedad abriendo puertas que en estos momentos están cerradas y creando oportunidades de empleo a todas las personas que lo necesiten por medio de la tierra que ella hoy en día trabaja ya que es su único patrimonio para dejarle a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Olinda is a 27 year old young woman. She’s a housewife and a farmer; she’s married and has two children who live at home. She has a college education, graduating with a degree in merchandising and accounting though she’s not currently working in that profession. A while ago her partner emigrated to the United States to seek a better quality of life, be able to support his wife's coffee production, and other reasons. 

She has a coffee farm which she’s had for three years. It was her parents and her partner in Honduras who taught her how to work the land. Only she and her in-laws are involved in the agricultural work activities like cleaning, composting, fertilizing and harvesting.

Currently Olinda is asking for help in buying fertilizer, manure, and chemicals used in growing coffee. If she doesn’t do regular maintenance, there might be rust damage.  

She dreams of educating her children so that they can have a better quality of life and better work opportunities. She wants to be able to open doors in society that are now closed and to and create job opportunities for all the people who need them through the land she works since this is the only thing she has to leave her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies like to be able to maintain and clean her coffee farm.

loans.name: Nazrullo

texts.ru:
Назрулло житель города Дангара. Ему 57 лет. У него высшее образование. По профессии он учитель. Однако последние 7 лет Назрулло занимается торговым бизнесом. Назрулло женат, имеет сына и дочь, которые являются учениками средней школы. 
Рядом с домом Назрулло имеет магазин, где он вместе с женой занимается продажей продуктов питания. В частности он в своем магазине продает чай, сахар, соль, масло, конфеты, печенье, макароны и т.д., а также хозяйственные товары. Чтобы увеличить товарооборот Назрулло просит кредит. Он хочет купить разнообразный ассортимент продуктов питания для привлечения большего количества клиентов.
texts.en:
Nazrullo is a resident of the city of Dangara. He is 57 years old and has higher education. He is a teacher by profession. However, for the last 7 years Nazrullo has been engaged in retail. Nazrullo is married and has a son and a daughter who are high school students.

Next to their home, Nazrullo has a store where he and his wife sell food products. At his store he in particular sells tea, sugar, salt, butter, candy, cookies, pasta and so on, and also household goods. In order to increase turnover, Nazrullo requests a loan. He wants to purchase a varied assortment of food product in order to attract a larger number of customers.

loans.use: to purchase food products in order to increase turnover

loans.name: Mele

texts.en: Mele is 40 years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as sugar, flour, rice, etc. She has been doing this for many years. Mele needs a loan to buy a freezer, chicken, rice, lamb chops, sugar, flour, beer and cigarettes for her store. She hopes to use her profits to provide for her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, chicken, rice, lamb chops, sugar, flour, beer and cigarettes

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 33 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past ten years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her drug shop, which sells drugs. 

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more medicine to sell, and will help Sylvia to generate greater profits and take care of her family’s needs. Sylvia hopes that in the future, she will be able to become a very powerful entrepreneur. 

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sylvia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru: Сафаргул является скотоводом, проживающим в районе Дангара. Она в течение 6 лет занимается выращиванием крупнорогатого скота. Сафаргул замужем. Ей 26 лет. У нее двое маленьких детей. Ее муж работает мастером, предоставляющим услуги по ремонту домов. Сама Сафаргул разводит крупнорогатый скот для дальнейшей продажи. Ей в закупе и продаже скота помогает муж. Сейчас для развития бизнеса Сафаргулу необходимо увеличить поголовье скота. Она просит кредит, чтобы закупить коров и телят для продвижения деятельности.
texts.en:
Safargul is a cattle breeder who is living in the Dangara region. She has worked with breeding cattle for a period of 6 years. Safargul is married. She is 26 years old and has two small children. Her husband works as a master builder, offering a service of repairing houses. 

Safargul breeds cattle for further sale. Her husband helps her in buying and reselling cattle. Currently, in order to develop the business, it is necessary for Safargul to increase the number of cattle. She requests a loan to purchase cows and calves to advance the business.

loans.use: to purchase cows and calves in order to increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es: Zulema, de 65 años de edad, está divorciada del padre de su hija con quien vive en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Zulema es la venta de comida como desayunos y almuerzos. Tiene un modesto restaurante ubicado en su propia casa, ahí tiene varias mesas y sillas las cuales están instaladas para brindar una  mayor comodidad a sus clientes quienes son atendidos siempre de manera amable y cordial ganándose de esa manera su preferencia. Tiene más de 30 años dedicándose a este negocio y hasta el momento su hija es quien más la ayuda en la atención de los clientes. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos constantes los cuales le sirven para pagar los gastos básicos que se generan en su hogar, además se siente tranquila trabajando en la comodidad de su vivienda. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas como arroz, azúcar, carnes, aceites y otros productos.
texts.en: Zulema is 65 years old and divorce; she lives with her daughter in her own home. Zulema’s business is the sale of meals, such as breakfasts and lunches. She has a small restaurant located in her home, where she has installed tables and chairs to make her customers more comfortable. She provides service that is always friendly and cordial, which has gained her many loyal customers. Zulema likes her business because it provides her with steady financial earnings that she can use to pay her basic household expenses; she also feels calmer when working in the comfort of her own home. At this time, Zulema is applying for a loan of S/. 2000 and is very happy about the possibility of receiving financial support, which would help her to feel confident in continuing with her business. She is also committed to again making on-time monthly payments. With this loan, Zulema will purchase the necessary ingredients for the meals she prepares, such as rice, sugar, meat oil and other products.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like rice, sugar, meat, oil and other products.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 49 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has six children, with one of them currently in school. For the past four years, Getrude has been working hard to manage her video library, which sells music CDs and movies. 

To help expand her business, Getrude has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more video movies and music tapes to sell, and will help Getrude to generate greater profits and provide basic needs for her family. Getrude hopes that in the future, she will be able to live a good life. 

Getrude is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Getrude who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more video movies and music tapes to sell.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
This is Maxima. She previously accessed a 10,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan that she used to buy more products, such as meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

Maxima would like to apply for a new 12,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients, such as rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products, needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and cover the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maxima dreams of expanding her business and hopes to always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients, such as rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products, needed in her business.

loans.name: Nadira

texts.en:
Nadira is a 53-year-old married mother of four children, for whom she puts in so much effort to provide them with the necessary life needs.

Nadira has been selling women’s shoes and bags of very good quality since 2008. Nadira is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with a special released collection

Nadira is a hardworking woman with a very good reputation. Her customers are loyal to her because she knows everyone's type and needs.

She hopes to expand her business to stay capable of covering her beloved children’s and her customers’ needs.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special released collection.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha, 53 years old, is married and has five children: two sons and three daughters. He and his wife support the family through the income they earn by making tea boxes. They began this business 30 years ago. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Ha intends to take out this loan to increase his working capital and buy materials to increase his production of tea boxes. The additional materials will enable him to increase his production for sales. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials to make tea boxes.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van is 49 years old and married with three children. He lives with his family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife does housework and takes care of their children. Van runs a shop manufacturing plastic components of metal ladders to earn a living. He started his business 25 years ago. 

Van intends to use this loan to gradually expand his business by buying materials to increase his production for sales. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials to make components of metal ladders.

loans.name: Pazilet

texts.ru: Пазилет 59 лет, вдова, воспитывает 1 сына. После смерти супруга, Пазилет очень долго не могла пережить утрату близкого человека. Нужно было воспитывать и ставить на ноги сына и Пазилет решила взять хозяйство и материальную ответственность в свои руки. Разведением скота занимается с 2003 года, начав этот бизнес с 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря ее неустанному труду и выдержке на сегодняшний день она получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом KGS. В хозяйстве у Пазилет имеется: 2 дойные коровы и 10 овец. В целях увеличения поголовья скота Пазилет обратилась в  Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 50,000 сом(KGS)  на покупку коров для дальнейшего разведения. На доходы от кредита Пазилет планирует увеличить поголовье скота, а также улучшить материальное благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Pazilet is 59 years old and a widow, who raises a son. After the death of her husband, Pazilet for a long time was not able to survive the loss of her loved one. It was necessary to educate her son and enable him to stand on his own feet, and Pazilet decided to take the household and financial responsibility in her own hands. 

Pazilet has worked with livestock breeding since 2003, after having started this business with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her relentless work and staying power, she today receives a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS). At Pazilet's farm she current has two dairy cows and ten sheep. 

With an aim to increase the number of livestock, Pazilet turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of cows for further breeding. Pazilet plans to increase the number of livestock with the income from the loan, and also to improve the material welfare of the family.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase her existing  African print cloth and cooking utensils  capacity.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba is an entrepreneur who is married and has 4 children. She is 34 years old. She has worked in animal husbandry for more than 15 years. Little by little, with the passing of the years,  she has perfected her knowledge. Thanks to the good condition of her animals, she has managed to win a large quantity of customers for her business. She sells her animals in the local market and has many customers. Many of her customers are local butchers who are glad for her work. 

Mahbuba is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way she will be able to offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. Moreover, she will be able to offer her son access to a better quality education and financial stability that will allow him to progress. She is asking for a loan of 10000 Somoni to buy young cattle for increasing her working capital to develop  her business further. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase her working capital

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 40 años, está casada y tiene una hija con quien vive en su casa propia. Margarita se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, cada dos días se dirige al mercado mayorista de la ciudad en donde compra los productos mas solicitados por sus clientes y de esta forma consigue surtir su negocio. Los artículos de mayor demanda son aquellos de consumo masivo como arroz, azúcar, aceite, huevos, leche, plátanos, cereales, embutidos y gaseosas. Su tienda está instalada en el frontis de su vivienda y cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientela gracias a que en su sector no hay otro negocio similar. Realiza esta labor desde hace 3 años y trabaja generalmente sola. Le gusta mucho su trabajo pues le permite tener tiempo para cumplir otras actividades y obtener ingresos económicos extras. En está oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará mercadería para su tienda tales como arroz, huevos, leche, aceites entre otros productos.
texts.en: Margarita is 40 years old and married with one daughter, with whom she lives in her own home. Margarita works selling food products; she supplies her business by going every two days to the wholesale market in her city, where she buys the products that are most popular with her customers. The products in highest demand are also the most basic products, such as rice, sugar, oil, eggs, milk, bananas, grains, cold cuts and carbonated beverages. Margarita’s store is located at the front of her home and she has a large clientele due to the fact that there is no other similar business nearby. Margarita has had this store for three years and she usually works alone. She likes her work very much because it gives her time to do other things and earn extra income. At this time, Margarita is applying for a loan of S/. 1,000; she is grateful and happy about the possibility of receiving the financial support she needs to continue with her business. With this loan, Margarita will purchase merchandise for her store, such as rice, eggs, milk and oil, as well as other products.

loans.use: to purchase food products such as rice, eggs, milk, oil and other products.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika, de 51 años, es una mujer amable y emprendedora. Es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos pero solo vive con uno de ellos en su casa propia. Erika se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, cosméticos y perfumería en general. Ofrece a su distinguida clientela finas fragancias de reconocidas marcas orientadas básicamente al público femenino. Tiene una amplia vitrina en donde diariamente exhibe todos los productos que ofrece a la venta, además complementa sus ventas con accesorios utilitarios como correas, ganchos, collares, dijes, aretes o calzados para damas y caballeros. Lleva realizando esta labor desde hace 5 años brindando en cada venta un trato cordial acompañado de una amplia sonrisa. Trabaja sola ya que se siente cómoda así, esto le permite distribuir sus ganancias económicas con suma prudencia, espera continuar trabajando ya que siente que su labor le permite hacer feliz a las mujeres. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su acceso al préstamo que necesita para cumplir con sus objetivos laborales. Con el monto solicitado comprará más cosméticos como cremas corporales, cremas faciales, talcos y perfumes para que continúe trabajando.
texts.en:
Erika, 51, is a friendly and enterprising woman.  She's divorced and has three children but lives in her own house with only one of them.

Erika makes a living selling beauty products, cosmetics, and a variety of perfume.  She sells her distinguished customers well-known brands of fine fragrances, especially for women.  She has a big display case where she shows all her products for sale every day.  She also sells useful accessories such as belts, hairpins, necklaces, pendants, earrings, and women's and men's footwear.

She has done this job for five years, offering cordial service with a broad smile with each sale.  She works alone because she's comfortable that way.  This allows her to distribute her earnings with great prudence.  She hopes to continue working because she thinks her job makes women happy.

Currently she'll request 1,000 soles [PEN].  She's grateful to all the people who make it possible for her to get the loan she needs to achieve her work goals.

With the requested amount she'll buy more cosmetics such as body lotion, face cream, powder, and perfume so she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
This is Nora, 52, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. Her partner is Editho, a driver, and they have children. She and her partner are managing their household as they operate a business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for their family.

Nora operates an internet café business. Services like this become a need as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She has customers who need to rent computers for business purposes, such as writing a resume and office documentation, as well as customers who would just love to surf the net and visit social networks. Nora also has a canteen. She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in profit every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, Nora is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business. Nora hopes that her business will flourish and dreams of having a happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh, 49, is married and has three children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife run a general store in front of their house. 

He started this business thirty years ago. He sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in his community. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock his store and better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to stock his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet, 55, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is retired. She earns an income running a shop that sells beverages and coffee in front of her house. 

She started this business 18 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of beverages and coffee to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy beverages and coffee to sell at her shop.

loans.name: Muoi

texts.en:
Muoi is 48 years old and is married. She and her husband have been running a general store in front of the door to their home for 13 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her her child. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Muoi is requesting a loan to expand her business by offering more food and many kind of soft drinks. With that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy food and many kinds of soft drinks to sell at her store.

loans.name: Yanis Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive la señora Yanis,  tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija de 16 años que estudia el quinto año de colegio. Su marido es comerciante.

Doña Yanis es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta trabajar con su marido para salir adelante, ellos trabajan en la venta de frutas y legumbres, tienen un puesto en un mercado en Manta, trabajan todos los días, él desde las 5h00  hasta las 16h00 y ella llega un poco más tarde luego que su hija se va al colegio y solo trabaja hasta el medio día ya que a esa hora llega su hija del colegio, su mercadería la compran a comerciantes mayoristas que venden en el mercado y ciertos productos los llevan desde Rocafuerte.

Este crédito es para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio comprando frutas y legumbres. Ella es fundadora del Banco Comunal y está muy contenta ya que gracias a los créditos a podido aumentar su negocio 

Sus sueños son tener una tienda en su casa y ver que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank Organized Women meet in the canton of Rocafuerte every fifteen days. Rocafuerte is known for its delicious sweets made by the locals, recognized throughout the country.

This is where Yanis lives. Forty-eight years old, she is married, and she and her husband have a 16-year-old daughter who is in her fifth year at the secondary school. Her husband is a businessman.

Yanis is a hardworking woman who enjoys working side by side with her husband to get ahead. They sell fruits and vegetables in a stand in the Manta market. They work every day. He works from 5:00 am until 4 o'clock in the afternoon. She starts a bit later, arriving immediately after sending their daughter to school, and works only until mid day, when her daughter arrives home from school. They purchase their merchandise from some wholesalers who set up in the market, and some goods they get from Rocafuerte. 

This loan will be used to continue investing in their business of purchasing fruits and vegetables. Yanis is a founding member of the communal bank, and she is very pleased that thanks to these credits, she has been able to expand her business. She dreams of running a shop in her home and of seeing her daughter become a professional.

loans.use: purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rene  Alberto

texts.es: Rene de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 15 y 3 años de edad, él se dedica a la elaboracion de ladrillos desde hace 6 años tiene mucha clientela por vender su producto a buen precio, con lo que gana de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Rene esta solicitando un credito para la compra de herramientas y materiales para elaborar mas ladrillos como palas, arena, tierra, etc. para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rene is 50 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and two children, who are 15 and 3 years old. He has been working making bricks for 6 years now and he has a lot of customers because he sells his product at a fair price. And so he is able to earn enough work in order to cover some of the household expenses. Rene is asking for a credit in order to purchase tools and materials to make more shovels. Some of these items include shovels, sand, soil and more. By making more bricks, he will earn more money and he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase shovels, sand, soil etc.

loans.name: Martha Valentina

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 28 años de edad mantiene una relación de unión libre de la tiene  tres hijos de 12, 6 y 4 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y escuela,  su marido ameniza fiestas pues tiene un disco móvil.

Doña Martha es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudarle a su esposo realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su trabajo, él tiene un disco móvil y por lo general dos o tres veces a la semana tiene fiestas o eventos donde el ameniza estas reuniones con la música y juegos de luces, el lleva más de 6 años con este trabajo y es así como saca adelante a su familia. 

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar discos y  juegos de luces que necesita y así brindar un mejor servicio. Lleva casi dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido ayudar en algo a su marido.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en: In the Rocafuente canton, the members of the Organized Women Communal Bank meet every two weeks. This area is known for its delicious sweets, prepared by the locals and famous throughout the country. It is also where Martha lives, who is 28 years old and has three children aged 12, 6 and 4 with her partner. The two oldest children go to school and her partner has a business renting out a mobile disco, which he hires out for parties. Martha is an excellent stay-at-home mother who is helping her husband by applying for this loan, which he will use for his business; he generally rents out his mobile disco and light show equipment two or three times a week at parties or events. He has been in this business for more than 6 years and and has been able to support his family with his income. He will use this loan to purchase the additional CDs and light show equipment he needs to offer better service. Martha has been involved with the Communal Bank for almost two years and likes being a member because she has been able to help her partner with the loans she receives. Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase CDs and light show equipment.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: hilda de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de pinchos de fruta( uvas, fresas, sandia, melon, etc.)desde hace varios años en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por ser un producto muy vendible, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña hilda esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar mas frutas por mayor sandias, uvas, melon, fresas, etc. para seguir con su negocio ya que es su unica fuente de trabajo y asi tener una mejor estabilidad economica con su familia.
texts.en:
Hilda, 40 years old, lives in her own home with her family. For several years, she has worked at selling fruit kebabs out of her home. She has a large customer base because her product is very popular. With her earnings from her sales, she has been able to meet her household expenses. 

Hilda is requesting this loan so that she can purchase more fruit at wholesale, including watermelon, grapes, melon, strawberries, etc. This will allow her to continue with her business, which is her only source of work, and thus provide economic stability for her family.

loans.use: purchase watermelon, grapes and other fruits at wholesale.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: Segundina, de 60 años, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, con quienes vive en su casa propia. Segundina se dedica a la venta de comida. Tiene un restaurante cerca de la plaza de armas de la ciudad y eso le permite tener gran cantidad de clientes que van en busca de los deliciosos y sustanciosos platos de comida que solo ella sabe preparar. Realiza esta actividad más de 15 años. Trabaja con ayuda de su cónyuge y de sus hijos desde muy temprano. Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que le permite tener tiempo disponible para estar en su casa a lado de sus hijos, además siente que le va muy bien ya que genera los ingresos económicos que necesita a diario, espera más adelante implementar su local de atención y reestructurarlo para brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para que pueda seguir adelante con su trabajo. Se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de  todas sus cuotas. El monto solicitado lo utilizará para comprar algunos ingredientes e insumos como carne de gallina, cerdo y res, fideos, papas, huevos, condimentos y otros productos que usa en la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Segundina is 60 years old, married, and has four children, who live in the house she owns.  Segundina works selling food.  She has a restaurant close to the main city square, which allows her to have a large quantity of customers who come in search of the delicious and wholesome plates of food that only she knows how to make.  She has done this work for more than 15 years.  She works together with her husband and children, starting very early.  She likes what she does very much since it allows her to have time available to be at home with her children.  She also feels that it is going well since it generates the income she needs every day.  She hopes in the future to restructure her restaurant to provide more comfort and service to her customers.  

She is currently requesting 500 soles.  She is very happy with the financial support provided so that she can move forward with her work.  She promises to make her repayments on time according to the schedule.  She will use the loan to purchase ingredients and supplies such as chicken, pork, beef, pasta, potatoes, eggs, condiments, and other products that she uses to prepare her foods.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as meat, pasta, eggs, condiments, and others.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 61 años de edad, está casada y tuvo 10 hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos viven con ella, el marido es agricultor. 

Doña María con la finalidad de ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar y al ver que su marido no gana mucho en el campo  se dedica a la producción y comercialización de dulces, todas las mañanas se levanta a las 5h00 a preparar los dulces los mismos que entrega a comerciantes que los venden en otros cantones y ciudades del país, en esta labor le ayuda uno de sus hijos. Tiene este negocio desde hace mas de 30 años y fue su mamá quien le enseño a preparar los dulces con lo cual ella se gana sus ingresos por el bienestar de su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar azúcar, frutas, huevos, leche y otros ingredientes necesarios para la fabricación de los dulces. Lleva cinco años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella sale adelante.  

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
In the region of Rocafuerte a group of associates known as the Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas meets every 15 days. This area is known for the delicious sweets that the locals make and that are known all over the country. 

This is also where Mrs. Maria lives. She is 61 years old, married, and had 10 children, who are all now adults. Two of her children still live with her and her husband is a farmer. 

Maria wants to help her husband with household expenses and because he doesn't earn much in the fields, she decided to make and sell sweets. Every morning at 5am she wakes up to begin preparing her sweets so she can give them to sellers who take them to other regions and cities all over the country. One of her children helps her in this. She has been doing this for more than 30 years and it was her mother who taught her how to make these sweets. With this small business, she is able to earn enough to contribute to the well being of her family.  

This loan will be used to purchase sugar, fruit, eggs, milk and other ingredients needed to make her sweets. She has been with this communal bank for 5 years and she likes it because the loans help her to improve and get ahead. 

Her dream is to continue to improve her life and to enjoy her health.

loans.use: purchase sugar, fruit, eggs, milk and other ingredients.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es: Clotilde, de 58 años, está casada y es madre de 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Clotilde se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, del mismo modo refacciona aquellas prendas que sus clientes le entregan con alguna imperfección hasta dejarlas en perfecto estado. Tiene su pequeño taller en su casa y lleva realizando este trabajo por 20 años, esto le permitió alimentar a su familia por mucho tiempo y gracias a ello también sus hijos pudieron recibir una buena educación. Trabaja sola y esta muy contenta ya que le esta yendo bien aunque en ciertas temporadas la clientela disminuye. Cuando se inició en esta actividad tenía dificultades por la falta de experiencia tales como la imprecisión en el corte de las telas o elegir la tela inadecuada para determinado tipo de prenda, sin embargo ha aprendido a superar estos contratiempos gracias al paso de los años y a las capacitaciones que ella misma buscaba para mejorar su trabajo. Ahora tiene mucha clientela. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales para seguir realizando su trabajo como elásticos, telas, botones, hilos de colores y otros.
texts.en: Clotilde, 58, is married and has 3 children, with whom she lives in her own home. Clotilde is a seamstress who creates new garments and also fixes flaws in clothing her clients bring to her, with perfect results. Clotilde has a small workshop in her home and has been working as a seamstress for 20 years, which has enabled her to feed her family for many years and also to obtain a good education for her children. She works alone and is very happy because the business is going well, although in certain seasons she has fewer clients. When Clotilde began this business, she experienced some problems, such as imprecise cuts in the fabric or choosing the wrong kind of fabric for a certain piece of clothing, but this was due to inexperience; as time passed and she gained skills in order to improve her work, she learned to overcome these setbacks. Today, she has a large clientele. At this time, Clotilde is applying for a loan of S/. 500 and is very happy about the possibility of receiving this financial support, which help her feel confident about continuing to grow her business. She is also committed to again making on-time monthly payments. With this loan, Clotilde will purchase the materials she needs to continue her work, such as elastic, fabric, buttons, colored thread and more.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials such as elastic, fabric, buttons, colored thread and more.

loans.name: María Manuela De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia fundadora del grupo de crédito 14 de agosto, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, lugar que goza de mucha vegetación, verdes campos y de una tranquilad sin igual, su gente es amable y gentil quienes se dedican en especial a la dura tarea que aprendieron de sus padres la cual es la crianza de animales y la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes actividades, aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. María tiene 73 años, es casada y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 8 hijos mayores de edad, están casados y viven independientes. Su esposo por su edad solo se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura.

Doña María se dedica a la cría de gallinas, cuyes, cerdos y ganado del cual vende la leche, también siembra y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar y si existe un sobrante lo vende. 

Su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de abono, semillas y alimento para sus animales. 

Su meta es tener más animales.
texts.en:
María is a founding member of the loan group "14th of August," and lives in the area of the parish of Zhidmad in Cuenca, a lush area blessed with green fields and unparalleled tranquility. The people there are friendly and courteous, and they live their lives dedicated to the hard work they learned from their parents, raising animals and agriculture. Many also live in the city doing many kinds of work, but they still maintain the culture and traditions of the villages.

María is 73 years old. She is married, and she and her husband have eight grown children who are married and live independently. Her husband works only at agriculture, due to his age.  María raises chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and dairy cows. She also keeps a garden for the household, selling any extra food.

She will use this loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizer, seeds, and feed for the animals. Her goal is to have more animals.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer, seeds, and animal feed.

loans.name: Hilda Marcelina

texts.es:
La Señora. Hilda es una de las socias fundadoras del grupo de crédito 14 de Agosto, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, lugar que goza de mucha vegetación, verdes campos y de una tranquilad sin igual, su gente es amable y gentil quienes se dedican en especial a la dura tarea que aprendieron de sus padres la cual es la crianza de animales y la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes actividades, aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Hilda tiene 42 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 21, 18 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segunda hija ayuda en los quehaceres de su hogar y su último hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad, su esposo labora en la área de la construcción, la casa en la que vive es el fruto del trabajo conyugal.
 
Doña Hilda trabaja como educadora comunitaria ya que brinda sus servicios cuidando a niños de 0 a 5 años de edad.  En su casa cría cerdos, cuyes, gallinas y ganado, también siembra y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar. 

Su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de abono para mejorar sus potreros y cultivos.

Su meta es tener más animales y de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Hilda is a founding member of the loan group "14th of August," and lives in the area of the parish of Zhidmad in Cuenca, a lush area blessed with green fields and unparalleled tranquility. The people there are friendly and courteous, and they live their lives dedicated to the hard work they learned from their parents, raising animals and agriculture. Many also live in the city doing many kinds of work, but they still maintain the culture and traditions of the villages.

Hilda is 42 years old. She and her husband have three children, aged 21, 18 and 7 years old. Their first child works and help out economically. Their second child helps with household chores, and their youngest is studying in a small school in the area. Her husband works in construction, and their home has been the result of both partners' hard work.

Hilda works as a community educator, and she provides her services by caring for children aged 0 to 5 years.  At home, she raises pigs, guinea pigs, chickens, and cattle. She also keeps a garden for the household.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of fertilizer to improve her pastures and crops. Her goal is to have more animals of greater quality.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer for her crops and pastures

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
JORGE LUIS
ES ORIGINARIO DE SAN MARTIN JILOTEPEQUE. ES UN JOVEN QUE A SU TEMPRANA EDAD A SEGUIDO EL EJEMPLO DE SUS PADRES Y SE HA DEDICADO A TRABAJAR PARA PODER CUBRIR SUS NECESIDADES Y SALIR ADELANTE EN LA VIDA, ACTUALMENTE TRABAJA MANEJANDO UN MOTOTAXI Y TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA Y ENGORDE DE PAVOS Y GALLINAS.  EL AREA Y LA POCA ES PROPICIA PARA ESTE TRABAJO Y TAMBIEN SON MUY COMERZIALIZADOS. JORGE SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA COMPRAR MAS PAVOS Y POLLAS, CONCENTRADO Y VITAMINAS YA QUE EL SUEÑO DE EL ES AGRANDAR UN POCO MAS SU CRIANZA DE ANIMALES, ESPERANDO QUE POR MEDIO DE SU AYUDA ELLA PUEDA SEGUIR ADELANTE.
texts.en: Jorge Luis is from San Martin Jilotepeque. He is a young man who, at an early age, followed the example of his parents and decided to work to be able to cover his needs and move forward in life. Currently, he works driving a motorcycle taxi and he also raises and fattens turkeys and hens. His small piece of land is favorable for this work and also both his businesses are in great demand. Jorge is applying for this loan to buy more turkeys and hens, concentrated feed and vitamins. His dream is to grow his animal raising business a little more. He hopes that through your help he can advance.

loans.use: To purchase animals for raising and for the purchase of animal feed.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli is 28 years old and she lives in Vanadzor city. Nelli is married and she has two small children. She has graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute, History and Legal Division, but now she works at an internet provider company as an operator. Nelli’s husband at this moment is unemployed and  from time to time, he does some reconstruction work with a very small fee for his work. Thus it happens that the major part of their family needs rests on Nelli’s fragile shoulders. No matter how hard she works, the needs and costs are endless.

 Lately Nelli’s work is too much and sometimes she needs to work at home also, but she has no computer. Nelli is asking for a loan of 250,000 Armenian drams to buy a computer, which will help her to work at home and lighten her workload.

loans.use: to buy a computer to lighten her workload

loans.name: Digna

texts.es: Digna, de 61 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, empeñosa y muy sociable. Está divorciada y sus hijos ya son independientes por eso vive en su casa propia en compañía de su hermano. La actividad que realiza Digna es el alquiler de cuartos para solteros , actualmente cuenta con 10 habitaciones cómodas y confortables las cuales están ocupadas por inquilinos permanentemente. Se dedica a esta labor desde hace 21 años y cuenta con el apoyo de su hermano quien se encarga de promocionar el servicio de alquiler. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera los ingresos económicos que requiere sin necesidad de realizar mucho esfuerzo físico, además gracias a su actividad se siente una mujer productiva y emprendedora. Su plan para el futuro es incrementar la cantidad de habitaciones que ahora tiene ya que su terreno es amplio y se presta para esta negocio. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para salir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como madera, pintura, clavos y listones para construir 2 cuartos para alquilar.
texts.en:
Digna is a hardworking, diligent, and sociable woman of 61 years. She is divorced and has independent children, so she lives in her own home in the company of her brother. Digna's work is to rent out rooms for single people. She has 10 convenient and comfortable rooms that are occupied by permanent tenants. She has done this work for 21 years and has the support of her brother who is in charge of promoting the renting service. She likes her business because it is a way to earn an income that she needs, without requiring too much physical effort. In addition, her work makes her feel like an entrepreneurial and productive woman. Her plan for the future is to increase the amount of rooms that she currently has since she has plenty of land that is rented out for this business. 

In this opportunity, she is requesting 1,500 Nuevos Soles. She is thankful for the financial help that she receives because it helps her move ahead in life. In addition, she is committed to making her loan payments punctually. The amount requested will be to invest in materials such as wood, paint, nails, and wooden planks to construct two new rooms to rent.

loans.use: purchase materials such as wood, paint, nails, and wooden planks to construct two new rooms to rent.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es: Don Emiliano es originario de la ciudad de Boaco, tiene 57 años de edad, casado y padre de 5 hijos. Se dedica a la pesca y agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo. En este negocio la apoya su familia quienes distribuyen sus productos en su sector. Su expectativa es seguir trabajando y aumentar sus ingresos a través de la inversión. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como: refrescantes, abono, fertilizante y gasolina para sus trabajos de agricultura y pesca. Sus metas futuras son cosechar en gran cantidad para obtener mayores ingresos y cancelar el crédito con el objetivo de seguir trabajando con los préstamos ya que son de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Emiliano is from the city of Boaco.  He is 57 years old, married, and he has five children.  He has been fishing and farming for a long time.  His family helps him in this business.  They distribute his products in his area.

His expectation is to continue working and to increase his income through this investment.  He is requesting the loan to buy supplies like cooling products, compost, fertilizer, and gasoline for his farm and fishing work.

His goal for the future is to harvest in large quantities in order to get greater income and pay off the loan.  His objective is to continue working with the loans because they are a great help.

loans.use: to buy cooling products, compost, fertilizer, and gasoline.

loans.name: Maria Rosela

texts.en:
This is Maria Rosela. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maria Rosela dreams of being more successful in her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: El Paraiso  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito El Paraíso está formado por 16 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar que goza de mucha vegetación y grandes paisajes gracias a su geografía accidentada, su clima es frió, sus tierras son muy fértiles propicias para la agricultura. Su gente es amable, gentil y tradicionalistas ya que aun guardan muy recelosamente las tradiciones que sus padres les inculcaron, su mayor fuente de ingresos es la crianza de animales, la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Delia, tiene 48 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos ya son casados y viven independientes, sus dos hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la vive es propia.

Doña Delia se dedica a la dura tarea del campo trabajo que le ha permitido aportar a la economía de su casa y sacar adelante a toda su familia. Siembra en sus terrenos y lo que  cosecha es para su casa y para la venta, también cría cerdos, cuyes y pollos los que vende en pie o pelados. 

Su crédito es para comprar pollos y así crecer en este negocio. 

Su meta es incrementar su criadero de pollos para la venta.
texts.en:
El Paraíso Group is made up of 16 women who live around Cumbe Parish in Cuenca, a place that has a lot of vegetation and vast landscapes thanks to its rugged geography.  The climate is cold and the fertile land is favorable for agriculture.
