The people there are friendly, courteous, and traditional, and they carefully protect the traditions passed down by their parents.  The biggest sources of income are raising animals and agriculture, and many people work in various jobs in the city.

One of the group members is Delia, 48.  She's married and has four adult children from this relationship.  Two of them are already married and live on their own; her two single children work and help her economically.  Her husband works as a bricklayer.  The house she lives in is her own.

Delia earns a living doing difficult work in the fields, which has allowed her to contribute to the household finances and get her whole family ahead.  She plants on her land, and what she harvests is for her home and for sale.  She also raises pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens, which she sells live or plucked.

Her loan is to buy chickens so she grows in her business.

Her goal is to increase her chicken nursery.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Zobia's Group

texts.en:
Zobia is the group leader of this three person lending group. She lives in a remote area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a poor family. She has a large family size with eight children. She is a responsible mother and always tries her best to provide better facilities to her children. 

Her husband is the only earner in the family, and his net income is too low to meet the household needs. He owns a clothing business. He purchases clothing from different areas and sell it at his community market at a profitable price. His customers love the variety he offers.


Zobia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase a variety of clothing to sell. Zobia will use profit amount for her children's educational needs as well as household expenses. She hopes that through this loan her husband will be able to work more efficiently. She feels very happy and relaxed after taking out the loan. She is thankful to all the BRAC Pakistan team and all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Kalerwe Tulla- Magidu Group

texts.en:
Magidu, a member of Kalerwe Tula Drivers’ Association, is 58 years of age, married and has eight children who all attend school. He also takes care of three dependents because their parents are incapable of meeting their needs such as school fees and clothing among others.
 
Magidu drives a taxi to earn a living. He started this job 20 years ago after failing to find formal employment and yet he had to meet the growing needs of his family. Magidu primarily does town service transportation, that is, he works around the city and in rare cases he is hired to go to the countryside.

 His major challenge is that, for the twenty years he has worked, Magidu has failed to purchase his own taxi, mainly because his employer pays him little money yet he has many responsibilities as a father. He therefore has  approached Ugafode Microfinance Limited (MDI) to provide him with a loan to complete the sum needed for an old taxi that he will call his own.

Magidu’s dream has always been to have his own taxi which will able to earn him higher wages than he gets from his boss, such that he can provide the best for his family.Thanks to Kiva lenders through Ugafode for making his dream come true.

loans.use: to complete the sum needed for a taxi

loans.name: Aifai

texts.en:
Aifai is a 40-year-old woman who is married with six children. She runs a small business selling tomatoes, cucumbers, pumpkins, etc. in her community or at the market. 

Aifai is asking for a loan to pay for her children's school fees. She will also use part of the loan to buy bush-knives, a file, vegetable seeds, a wheelbarrow and fertilizer. Aifai joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to pay school fees and to buy bush knives, a file, vegetable seeds, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer with part of the money.

loans.name: Viuline

texts.en:
Viuline is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees and rent as her greatest monthly expenses.

Viuline has operated a beauty salon business for the past one year. Her potential customers are women. She dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase hair chemicals, braids and hair conditioners for her salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair chemicals, braids and hair conditioners for her salon business

loans.name: Ma. Caselyn

texts.en:
Ma. Caselyn is a married woman and the mother of a three-year-old son from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in a food vending business for more than 2 years now. She sells home-cooked snack foods to the people in her town. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients to use, like flour, cassava, sugar, milk and others. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more, thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Ma. Caselyn hopes of expanding her business and to make it a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to use, like flour, cassava, sugar, milk and others.

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en: Aliitasi is 37 years old and married with 5 children. She runs a small business selling cabbages, cucumbers, etc. in her community and has been doing this for many years. She has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer and barbed wire. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Aliitasi will help improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer and barbed wire.

loans.name: Jessilyn

texts.en:
Jessilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Jessilyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Jessilyn's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, so she can sell greater quantities of palm fruit.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste, a 50-year-old married father of five children between 7 and 23 years of age, has been a rice farmer for 20 years. With this loan, he will buy more fertilizers and support labor costs incurred during rice production. Jean Baptiste is expecting to reinvest his profits in his rice production.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Swabra

texts.en:
Swabra is married with three children, two of whom go school and one who is still young. She lives in her own house that has both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Swabra makes fruit juice and sells it to passersby and her neighbors. Her greatest challenge is seasonality. With KES30,000 she wants to purchase a freezer for storing her juice. She joined Yehu for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer for storing her juice.

loans.name: Loi

texts.en:
Loi is a 51-year-old married woman. She lives with her two sons and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a worker in a fertilizer factory. For eight years Loi has run a business of making and selling incense to people in her community.

Loi would like a loan to purchase a machine for making incense to increase her production and sales. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy a machine for making incense.

loans.name: Felixberta

texts.en:
Felixberta, aged 43, is a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Felixberta has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items like candies, snack foods, biscuits, cooking oil, laundry soap and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Felixberta has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy items like candies, snack food, biscuits, cooking oil, laundry soap and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana, a 47-year-old married mother of five, works very hard to provide for them. Feliciana has been running a general store in the Philippines for 15 years, selling a variety of items such as sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, noodles, seasonings, biscuits, etc. She has requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Feliciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Helen is 48 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for 8 years.

She requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. In the future, Helen would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Sarfaraz's Group

texts.en:
Sarfaraz lives in the remote area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the responsible mother of two sons and four daughters. She always tries her best to provide better facilities for her children but belongs to a poor family. Her husband is the only person in the family who is earning but his net income is too low to meet the household needs. He owns a cosmetic shop in the market which is the only source of income for his family.  His customers love the variety he offers. 

Sarfaraz is the group leader of this two-person lending group. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase products for his shop. He will use the loan amount to purchase a variety of cosmetics like make-up kits, facial creams, hand lotions, scrubs and perfumes. 

Sarfaraz will use the profit amount for her children's educational expenses. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and her husband's shop and that he will buy a variety of cosmetics according to the latest trends. Sarfaraz is feeling happy and relaxed after taking out this loan. She is thankful to all of the BRAC Pakistan team and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics like make-up kits, facial creams, hand lotions, scrubs and perfumes.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is 46 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver for hire. She has two sons and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

For five years she has run a food stall for selling pork and noodles. She intends to use her loan to buy a better quality of meat, noodles and other ingredients to make better food to attract more new customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and that it will help her to improve her family's living conditions as well as to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy meat, noodles and other ingredients.

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le is 43 years old and is married. Her husband is a worker. She has two sons and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

She has run a food stall to sell pork and noodles at her house for five years. She intends to use her loan to buy a new scooter for working transportation and to buy a better quality of food and ingredients to attract more new customers.

Le hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a scooter, food and ingredients for her food stall.

loans.name: Edmun

texts.en:
This is Edmun. He previously accessed a 17,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories and to pay for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for him to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit, and also to buy some equipment for their repair shop. The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain the family's daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Edmun hopes to have more tricycles and wants to have a happy family. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Gigi

texts.en:
Gigi is 45 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as toothpaste, shampoo, coffee, noodles, soft-drinks, etc. In the future, Gigi would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of two children, Merly works hard to support her family. She has a retail business selling personal products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Merly has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva.

Merly is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more personal products to sell to her customers. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more personal products to sell.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is 51 years old and is married with three children, a son and two daughters. Her husband supports the family through a business of selling embroidery products. Loan has been running a general store in front of her home for 4 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to rear her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. Loan hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
Mathias, 27, is a young and energetic gentleman. He is married with two children; the eldest, aged six years, attends school. He has farmed rice for the past five years.

Mathias is applying for a 805,000 RWF loan through Urwego to buy more fertilizer and pay laborers during the rice harvest. The profits will be used to provide food for the family and other necessities.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and pay laborers during the rice harvest

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn is 33 years old and married with three children. She's in a business of selling a variety of vegetables and fruits in her community. She is a very hardworking mother. She wakes up early in the morning and cooks food for her children before going to sell her commodities. 

Due to a lack of capital, she is asking for a loan in the amount of Php 5,000 to buy cabbages, tomatoes, eggplant and bananas for her business. In the future, Rovelyn hopes that her business expands so that she can provide all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, eggplant and bananas for her business.

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is 54 years old and married with six children. For the past 34 years she has worked hard as a fisherwoman.

Bebiana is applying for an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. Her ambition is to invest more money in her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Iris Cecibel

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive la señora Iris, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad que estudian en la universidad y aun viven con ella. Su esposo trabaja en una escuela.

Doña Iris es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para solventar los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa cuando sus clientes necesitan algo. Ella sale a recorrer la localidad tres veces por semana para realizar sus ventas y cobra que deja a crédito. La mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil ya que allá le sale más barato, lleva más de 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le permite ayudar a sus hijos ya que a su marido no le alcanza para esto.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 3 años y le gusta porque con un crédito empezó su negocio. 

Sus sueños son tener su propio almacén y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the Organized Women Communal Bank meet in Rocafuerte Canton. The area is known for the delicious sweets made by the locals, which are renown throughout the entire country. This is where Iris lives. She is 49 years old, married, and has three grown children who are enrolled at the university, though they still live with her. Her husband works at a school. 

Iris is a very determined woman who enjoys working to take care of her children's education costs. She works selling clothing of all types door to door, and also in her home when customers need something. She makes the rounds in her area three time a week in order to make sales and collect payments from customers buying on credit. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil where prices are lower. She has been running this business for over 3 years and it has allowed her to support her children, seeing as how her husband doesn't have the resources to do so. 

This loan will be used to buy a variety of clothing. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for 3 years and she likes it because she used a loan to start her business. Her dreams are to have her own shop and for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Phillippe

texts.en:
Phillippe is 52 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have six children. He has been a rice farmer for the past 30 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs for use during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the rice farming.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and to pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Arlene works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a motorcycle repair shop and a general store. Arlene is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns more income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like fruits, eggs, sugar, etc. for her food vending business. Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fruits, eggs, sugar, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Xavier

texts.en:
Xavier is 26 years old. He has one child, age one. His wife works as a farmer. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs for use during rice production. With the profits from the business he will take care of the rest of the family's concerns which may arise.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and to pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, 44, is the widowed mother of four children (the photo shows her and a UGAFODE credit officer). She has managed to educate and care for her sons ever since she lost her husband fifteen years ago. On the land her husband bought she has managed to put up rental houses. It is the income derived from these houses that has helped her and her children survive.

Because Esther has undeveloped land on which she could build more rental units, she is applying for a 3,000,000 UGX loan through UGAFODE. With the loan she could build those houses and plaster those, such as the unfinished rental shown in the picture, as well.

Esther’s ambition is to see that her sons all receive educations at the university. She would also like to see all free space on her land put to use so that she can retire without worry.

loans.use: To build more rentals and plaster those yet unfinished.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fixtures, renovate and decorate her premises, buy equipment, and pay off her debts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy extra palm fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Alegria Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Alegría está en el 7º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas y cada una de ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y a ir mejorando.
Dominga  es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, golosinas y gaseosas y  el crédito lo utiliza para la compra de ropas para volver a surtir su stock, ella en su última encuesta se encontraba fuera de la línea de la pobreza, pero de igual manera sigue muy entusiasmada invirtiendo el dinero del préstamo que realiza dentro del comité, lo que le ayuda a invertir en su negocio y a seguir mejorando sus ingresos y el de su familia.
También se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder progresar continuamente.
texts.en:
The communal bank Alegría (Happiness) is in its 7th loan cycle with the women's program. The group members are participating in the poverty reduction survey, in which they are learning to work together and get ahead. 

Dominga, one of the members, sells clothing, candies, and beverages. She will use the loan to buy clothing for inventory. She was living above the poverty line in the last survey, but she continues to enthusiastically invest the funding from the women's program in her business and to increase her and her family's income. The work of the advisors, who continuously follow up on training and required certifications while encouraging the women to strive for progress, is exemplary.

loans.use: to buy clothing for inventory.

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Blas ya está en su ciclo número 8º ellas hacen la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una de ellas. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juana, quien es peluquera, y comenta que su negocio está creciendo y mejorando día a día gracias al esfuerzo que ella está haciendo por superarse.
Juana es una persona muy trabajadora, tiene muy buena clientela gracias al buen servicio que siempre da a sus clientes. Quiere ir mejorando su local y de esa forma poder dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, y también poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de shampoo, enjuagues, tintes y demás insumos para poder seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes y también aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Blas is in its 8th loan cycle, and the members are participating in the poverty reduction survey to determine their status. Juana, one of the members, is a hair stylist, who says her business is growing and improving each day, thanks to her efforts to succeed. Juana works hard and has loyal clients, who appreciate her good service. 

Juana wants to renovate her space so that she can better serve her clients and provide employment to others. She has applied for a loan to buy shampoo, rinses, dyes, and other supplies so that she can keep offering her clients good service and also earn more income.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, rinses, dyes, and other supplies.

loans.name: Edeliza

texts.en:
Edeliza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

Edeliza requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits and other groceries for her general store.

In the future, Edeliza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits and other groceries for her general store.

loans.name: Franco

texts.en:
Franco is an old client of the institution who has applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000. He has operated two dairy shops and driven a motorcycle in the outskirts of the city for two years. 

The purpose of the loan is to plaster his residential house so that he and family can have decent accommodation. He will use the balance to diversify his dairy business by stocking other general merchandise. He is an honest and hardworking man, but he has always been constrained by financial issues in his business. 

Franco says given the loan, he will stop renting, and also restock his shop. Being able to have a bigger market will allow him to serve more than just those who buy dairy products from him. He has future hopes of expanding his business and living in a complete house, given the loan amount for which he has applied.

loans.use: To plaster his house

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a secretarial service in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and a trisikad (pedicab) transportation business. 

Gloria is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy office supplies and other miscellaneous items for her secretarial services business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy office supplies and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda, 45, is married to Christoforus, 48. They have two children: seventeen-year-old Lusiana, a senior high school student, and four-year-old Dionisius, who attends preschool.

Ermelinda sells bed linens to help cover her family’s needs as well as her children’s school fees. She began her business with 2,500,000 IDR lent to her by a friend. She also moved into furniture and electronics sales.

In the near future Ermelinda is going to start selling goods at the local night market. With this in mind she is applying for a 4,500,000 IDR loan through TLM to buy stock such as cutlery and drinks to sell there as well as pay for her children’s daily needs. She wishes to see her business succeed so she can repay her loan right away.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell at the local night market

loans.name: Milagro Group

texts.es:
El comité Milagro son de la ciudad de Lambaré van por su segundo préstamo, muchas de ellas gracias a la primera línea de crédito han ampliado sus negocios, otras han iniciado en la elaboración de comestibles.
Nancy es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la costura, es muy buena en lo que hace y es muy conocida por su buen trabajo. Es una persona que trabaja y lucha por salir adelante. También cuenta que está muy feliz por formar parte del grupo, ya que le permite capacitarse y seguir creciendo.
Hoy Nancy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en comprar telas, hilos, botones y demás insumos, con lo que podrá seguir haciendo sus confecciones y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en: The "Miracle" committee is from the city of Lambare and this is their second loan, many of the members have expanded her businesses thanks to the first loan, others have started some making food items.  Nancy is part of this group, she makes is a seamstress, very good at what she does and well known for her good work.  She is a person that works and fights to get ahead.  She is also very happy to be a member of the group, because it allows her to get training and continue growing.  Currently Nancy requests this loan to invest it in buying fabric, thread, buttons and other materials, with them she will be able to continue making her designs and finish her customer's orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other materials.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 45 years old. He is a father of eight children; seven of them go to school. He has been a rice farmer for the past 26 years. 

He has requested a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family and to take care of the rest of the family concerns.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret appreciates the previous loan from Kiva that enabled her to improve her profit margin.

She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase fabrics, thread, needles and materials for her business.

She joined Yehu to access the loan funds.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, thread, needles and materials for her business.

loans.name: Hernán Darío

texts.es:
Hernán, a sus 46 años de edad es casado y padre de 2 hijos de 12 y 14 años. Toda su vida ha vivido en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agrícolas gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre, quien siempre fue agricultor. Actualmente posee cultivos de flores como hortensias, y cultivos de tomate de aliño, fresas y fríjol, cuya cosecha es vendida en el mercado del pueblo donde reside y cuenta con el apoyo de 3 empleados que laboran al jornal; esta actividad la alterna laborando como conductor de un taxi, prestando el servicio en la zona urbana y rural del municipio; todo esto le genera los ingresos suficientes para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Hernán es un hombre pujante, emprendedor, activo y muy buen trabajador, pues labora arduas jornadas diariamente, en las mañanas se dedica al cuidado de sus cultivos y en las tardes sale a trabajar en el taxi, estas actividades las ha realizado desde hace 20 años aproximadamente. 
El cliente solicita el crédito como un apoyo, para hacerle frente a los obstáculos que se le presentan debido a los altos costos de los insumos agrícolas; éste será invertido en la compra de abonos, riegos, fungicidas y fertilizantes para poder continuar con el cuidado de todos sus cultivos y así poder cosechar productos de muy buena calidad, que pueda vender a mejor precio en el mercado y así aumentar sus ingresos.  Hernán sueña con darle continuidad a su negocio, hacerlo crecer y que sea perdurable en el tiempo para continuar generando oportunidades de empleo y que le ayuden a tener una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos y mejor calidad de vida para toda la familia.
texts.en:
46-year old Hernán is married and has two children aged 12 and 14. He has lived his whole life in the country where he learned about agriculture from his father who has always been a farmer. He now owns land where he grows flowers like hydrangeas, as well as salad tomatoes, strawberries, and beans. After harvesting the crops, he sells them in the local market. He has three laborers whom he hires on a daily basis.

Hernán also works as a taxi driver serving the towns and villages of the municipality. These two jobs bring in enough money to pay for household necessities. He is a thriving, enterprising, active and hardworking man who works long days. Mornings are spent in his fields, and afternoons and evenings driving his taxi. He's done this work for approximately 20 years.

Hernán is seeking a loan to help him overcome some problems that he is facing due to the high cost of agricultural supplies. He plans to use the money to buy manure, sprinklers, fungicide, and fertilizer so that he can continue to provide good care for his crops and get a high-quality harvest. He will be able to sell the produce for a better price in the market and increase his income.

Hernán's dream is to expand his business and make it sustainable so that he can continue to generate employment. In turn this will lead to greater economic stability and the opportunity to provide his children with a better education and a better standard of living for the whole family.

loans.use: Buy farming supplies (manure, sprinklers, fungicide, fertilizer)

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is a 43-year-old woman. She is the leader of this group. 

Khalida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. He owns a babies’ cot bedsheet shop in the market. He stitches beautiful and colourful bedsheets for babies’ cots and sells them in the main market. He needs capital to purchase cloth and thread for making bedsheets. However, due to lack of finances, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife has asked for a loan to help him, as his shop is the only source of income for his family. This loan amount is very important to continue his work. 

Khalida wants to buy a refrigerator for the preservation of food in the summer season with the profit amount. She is feeling very happy and relaxed after taking the loan. She is thankful to all the BRAC Pakistan team and all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and thread for making bedsheets.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a 49-year-old married mother of four children; her husband is retired. She has been selling fruits and vegetables since January 2012 to help cover the family’s expenses.

Zahra would like to expand her shop space and increase and diversify her products, but she hasn’t the finances to do so. But with a loan through Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua she will take her first step towards making her dreams come true. She is applying for a 1500 USD loan to buy new metal display stands and stock her shop with seasonal products.

Zahra’s ambition is to convert her shop into a larger convenience store and sell organic homemade preserved foods. She is very excited about this loan!

loans.use: to buy new metal display stands and stock her shop with seasonal products.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene was born in 1976; he is married with two children, who are 6 years old and 8 years old and they go to school. His wife works as a farmer. Jean Damascene has been a rice farmer for the past 19 years. With the loan, he wants to buy fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production. The profits from his produce will be used in becoming a self-sustainable family for a better future.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Elkin Eladio

texts.es: Elkin, a sus 42 años de edad es separado y padre de 1 hijo de 10 años. Toda su vida productiva la ha dedicado a las labores agropecuarias, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. Actualmente posee ganado lechero y la producción que saca, la vende en el mercado del pueblo donde reside, con lo cual genera ingresos para solventar las necesidades de su hijo y de su familia y, para el pago del empleado directo que le colabora en la labor. Elkin es un señor juicioso, trabajador y pujante, lucha constantemente para sacar adelante a su hijo, por esta razón solicita el crédito que será invertido en la compra de ganado (2 vacas productoras de leche) con el fin de continuar con su negocio, aumentando la producción del líquido y así mejorar sus ingresos, esto le permitirá avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su sueño que es tener ganado de diferentes razas, no sólo lechero sino, complementar con ganado de levante, para tener más posibilidades de negociar y mejorar su margen de ganancia, lo que le dará la oportunidad de brindar una mejor educación a su hijo y tener una estabilidad económica favorable.
texts.en:
Elkin, 42, is separated and the father of a 10-year-old son. He has spent his working life in agriculture, thanks to his parents' training. He owns milk cows, and he sells the milk they produce in the local market. The income this generates pays for his son's and his family's basic needs and his employee's wage. 

Elkin is prudent, hard working, and vigorous. He strives to provide for his son, and he has applied for a loan to buy two milk-producing cows so that he can keep his business going, increase production, and earn more. This will help him realize his dream of owning different cattle breeds, not just milk cows, by acquiring breeding stock. He will have more business opportunities and improved profit margins, which will allow him to offer his son a better education and to have a stable financial situation.

loans.use: to buy two milk-producing cows.

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en: Godwin is a 34-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For two years, he has been operating a retail shop and also practices farming to earn extra income. Customers not paying on time and high cost of operation are his major challenges, while his dream is to own a wholesale shop. Godwin intends to use the loan to buy sugar for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar for resale.

loans.name: Yowasi

texts.en: Yowasi is a 29-year-old married man with two children. He lives in Kasese,Uganda and owns a retail shop that specifically sells African wear at the border between Congo and Uganda. His major clients are travelers. Inadequate capital and price fluctuation are his major challenges. While his dream is to trade in wholesale, Yowasi intends to use the loan to buy dresses to sell.

loans.use: to buy dresses to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
This is Lilia. She previously obtained an 13,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her rug-making business. Her earnings were a big help with personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of 15,000 PHP, to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lilia hopes to have an alternative business and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and it is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her rug-making business.

loans.name: Mujeres Divinas Group

texts.es:
Las 23  integrantes de este comité se están esforzando y quieren salir adelante para poder ayudar a sus familias. Todas y cada una de ellas están con muchas esperanzas de que podrán ayudar a sus seres queridos. Hay que notar también que están capacitándose para poder mejorar sus condiciones de trabajo.
Maria es una persona muy trabajadora, tiene una olería en la que fabrica ladrillos para la venta, se hizo de buena clientela ya que es una persona muy cumplida con sus clientes y con los pedidos que recibe. Ella quiere seguir trabajando y esta bastante motivada para hacerlo.
Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de arcilla y leña, que le permitirá seguir haciendo los ladrillos que vende, y así seguir teniendo los ingresos para ayudar a su familia. Agradecen todas las integrantes por esta gran oportunidad que están recibiendo de kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The 23 members of this communal bank work hard, and they want to get ahead to support their families. Each and every one has a lot of hope that they can support their loved ones. It’s also important to note that they are being trained to improve their work conditions. 

Maria is a very hardworking person. She has a brick making shop in which she makes bricks to sell. She has a good clientele since she’s very good with her customers and with the orders she receives. She wants to continue working, and she’s quite motivated to do so. 

Today she’s asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of clay and wood which will allow her to keep on making bricks to sell and earning money to support her family.  She is thankful to all involved for the wonderful opportunity she’s gotten from Kiva and Fundacion Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy clay and wood to make bricks.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en: Amer is 20 years old. He lives in Amman, Jordan, with his family which consists of seven members. Amer is currently studying for a Bachelor of Computer Technology degree, in his first year. He also works in cell phone sales. Amer is planning to expand his project of selling cell phones after graduation. Now he is asking for a loan to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Lana

texts.en:
Lana, 23, lives with her family of eight. She has three brothers and two sisters. 

Lana is currently in her third year of a Bachelor of Business Administration program. She is planning to work in her field of study after graduation. Now, however, she is asking for a loan to pay for her study fees as she is facing financial problems.

loans.use: To pay for her study fees

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 33 years old. He is married with four children. He has been a rice farmer for the past 15 years, and he has spent most of his entire career in growing rice. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to upgrade his farming ability in the future.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung, 43 years old, is widowed and has a daughter. She supports her family through the income she earns from rewinding thread. She has been in this business for thirty years. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Dung intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy thread. The additional materials will enable her to increase her production for sales. She hopes that her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy thread for rewinding.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is 54 years old and married with five children, two sons and three daughters. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn income by rewinding thread. She started her business twenty years ago. 

She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a greater quantity of thread to increase her production for sales. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy thread for rewinding.

loans.name: Kiet

texts.en:
Kiet, 57, is married and has three sons. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. They earn an income running a food stall in front of their house. 

He started this business 23 years ago. Kiet is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a larger quantity of rice, spices, and pork to increase his production of food to better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy pork, rice, and spices to make food to sell.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong, 38, is married and has four children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. They have been running a business of rewinding thread for ten years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more thread to increase her production for sales.

She hopes her business runs smoothly to generate a higher income to help her improve her family's living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy thread for rewinding.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 19 years old. He is single and lives in Mafraq, Jordan with his family, which consists of 5 members in a rented house. He has 2 sisters. His father has retired from the military and his mother is a teacher. Ahmad is currently studying Bachelor of Nursing and is in his first year. He is planning to work in his field of study after graduation. As his family is currently having financial problems, he is asking for a loan to pay for his education fees.

loans.use: to pay for his education fees.

loans.name: Jovenes Solidarios Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Jóvenes Solidarios está en su ciclo 1º del programa de comité de Jóvenes, donde todos están con mucho entusiasmo de poder empezar a trabajar desde muy jóvenes.
Un integrante del grupo es Alfredo, quien está empezando a trabajar y esta con mucho entusiasmo de poder empezar a ayudar a su familia. Es un joven muy visionario que quiere ser útil a su hogar.
El se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, y solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas y demás artículos, y agradece por esta oportunidad que se está dando a los jóvenes.
texts.en:
The group called Jóvenes Solidarios is in its 1rst cycle with the Youth Program committee. All of them are very enthusiastic to be able to start working very young.  begin.

One member of the group is Alfredo. He is starting to work and is very eager to hep his family. He is a young man with a vision who wants to be useful in his home.

He works as a street vendor selling all types of products. He is asking for this loan to invest in buying clothing and other items. He is grateful for this opportunity that is being given to young people.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Fabienne

texts.en:
Fabienne is 35 years old. He is married with four children, and his wife works as a farmer. He has been working as a rice farmer for the past 17 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizer and cover labor costs during rice production. The profits from the rice will be used to assist in improving standard of living and taking care of the family's need.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and to cover labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Enas

texts.en:
Enas is 21 years old. She lives with her family which consists of eight members. She has four brothers, with two of them in the military, and three sisters. 

Enas is currently in her second year studying for her Bachelor of Offices Administration. She was facing problems bringing the needed equipment for her study because of the financial crisis that she was facing. She is now asking for a loan to help her pay for her study fees as she doesn't have money for it.

loans.use: To pay for her study fees

loans.name: Juntas Podemos Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Juntas Podemos está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Ellas están empezando a conocerse y a trabajar juntas, tienen grandes aspiraciones y quieren seguir creciendo.
La Sra. Patricia es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, ella siempre tiene buena variedad de prendas y es por eso que su clientela es bastante, ella es muy buena para las ventas y tiene un gran carisma, eso es lo que la ayuda mas. Es muy trabajadora y conforme pasan los ciclos quiere seguir mejorando y capacitándose.
La sra. Patricia solicita de este crédito para la compra de variedad de ropas para damas y niños, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called Juntas Podemos [Together we Can] is in its first cycle of the Women's Committee where they all work and help each other get ahead. They are starting to get to know each other and work together. They have big dreams and they want to keep growing. 

Patricia is one of the members. She sells clothes and she always has a variety of clothing and that is why she has a lot of customers. She is very good at sales and has a lot of charisma, which helps her more. She is very hardworking and as the cycles go by, she wants to keep improving and training. 

Patricia is asking for this loan to buy a variety of clothing for women and children. This will help her to firm up her business plan, which will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy necessary, updated equipment for his business.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a thirty-two-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the retail business for nine years, but also farms, rears cows, and has a motorcycle transport business. Being a good mother, she desires to earn enough to educate her children up to the university level despite challenges of stiff competition and inadequate capital. Margret intends to use the loan to buy saucepans and glasses to sell.

loans.use: to buy saucepans and glasses to sell.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, in particular food and beverages, to stock her store.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung is a 38-year-old married woman. She lives with her two sons and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money making pork pies. For ten years, she has run a business of rewinding thread for selling.

Nhung would like a loan to purchase a larger quantity of thread. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy thread to rewind.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: Rodrigo, con 62 años, es casado y padre de 6 hijos. Toda su vida la ha pasado en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agrícolas y se dedicó a ellas durante la mayor parte de su vida productiva. Su último empleo duró 4 años, desempeñándose como operario agrícola en un cultivo de flores, pero desde hace un 1 año se le presentó la oportunidad de convertirse en socio del dueño del cultivo y hacerse cargo de él, firmó un contrato donde se dividían los costos, gastos y utilidades en partes iguales. Esto le ha permitido generar los ingresos necesarios para llevar el sustento a su hogar. El cliente es un señor pujante, emprendedor, trabajador, él manifiesta que su edad no es ningún impedimento para hacer lo que le gusta y ha luchado incansablemente para sobrepasar los obstáculos que se le presentan debido a los altos costos de los insumos agrícolas, pues no ha tenido flujo de caja constante porque sus clientes pagan a 3 meses. Es por esta razón que solicita el apoyo del crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en el pago de algunos gastos mensuales (nómina de empleados, fletes y servicios públicos) pues son cuentas que no dan espera y de esta manera podrá continuar con el sostenimiento del cultivo. Rodrigo sueña con tener su cultivo propio, cuyas ganancias le permitan continuar solventando las necesidades básicas de su hogar y poder disfrutar de una vejez más tranquila al lado de su familia.
texts.en: Rodrigo is 62 years old. He is married and the father of 6 children. He has spent his whole life in the country, where he learned farm work and has done it for most of his productive life. His last job lasted 4 years. He worked as a farm laborer in flower cultivation, but a year ago he had the opportunity to become a partner in a farm and run it. He signed a contract in in which expenses, costs and profits are divided in equal parts. This has allowed him to generate the income he needs to support his home. He is a driven, enterprising, hardworking man. He says that his age is no barrier to do what he likes   and he has fought tirelessly to overcome obstacles that come along due to the high costs of agricultural materials. He has not had a constant cash flow because his customers pay him every three months. That is the reason he is asking for the help of the loan in order to invest it in paying for some monthly expenses (payroll, shipping, and utilities). These are expenses that can't wait and this way he can continue supporting his crop. Rodrigo dreams of having his own crop, whose earnings would allow him to continue paying his basic household expenses and enjoy and calm old age at his family's side.

loans.use: to pay some monthly expenses (payroll, shipping and utilities) because they are bills that can't wait.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
This is Edwina. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more products for her school supplies business. Her income from her business helped her in sending her child to school, as well as in their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of 18,000 PHP, to buy more stock of school supplies. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Edwina dreams to have other sources of income and hopes to have a good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of office/school supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Vianney

texts.en:
Vianney is a father of three. His wife helps him in growing rice and they have spent nine years in rice growing. With the loan, Vianney plans to buy more fertilizer and cover labor costs during rice production. The profits from the rice production will be used to provide food for the family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and cover labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Kirizo

texts.en: Kirizo is a 41-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda.He has been in the business  of decoration sales for nine years and also earns a salary from teaching. With the proceeds from his business, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and improve the quality of his services. He desires to expand his services to the city and neighboring districts, despite the challenges of inadequate capital and competition. Kirizo intends to use the loan to buy decoration materials for use in his business.

loans.use: to buy decoration materials for use in his business.

loans.name: Aybubu

texts.ru: Айбубу 49 лет, замужем, многодетная мать, воспитывает 5 детей (2 дочери и 2 сына). Образование-среднее. После окончания средней школы Айбубу вышла замуж совсем в юном возрасте. С 1993 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 7,000 сом KGS. Супруг и дети активно помогают по бизнесу. Семья очень сплоченная и дружная. Благодаря упорному труду и терпеливому характеру Айбубу, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее  хозяйство: 2 дойные коровы, 2 теленка и 10 овец. Также в наличии имеет 1,20 ГА поливной земли, на которой ежегодно выращивает картофель и многолетние травы. Прибыль позволила Айбубу размножить скот в домашнем хозяйстве и тем самым улучшить семейное благосостояние. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айбубу обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят. Доходы от кредита Айбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, а также намерена достроить дом, в котором она проживает вместе со своей семьей.
texts.en: Aybubu is a 49 year old married mother of many children. She has four children (two daughters and two sons). She has an average education. After finishing middle school Aybubu married at a young age. She has been engaged in agriculture since 1993, mostly in livestock and arable farming, which she began with a 7,000 Kyrgyzstani Somoni Loan. Her spouse and children are active and support the business. Her family is close and united. Thanks to her hard work and patient character, Aybubu currently has a good farm: two dairy cows, two calves, and ten sheep. Also she has 1.2 hectares of irrigated land on which she grows potatoes and perennial grasses. With profits Aybubu could breed livestock for the farm and improve her family's well-being. In order to develop her farm Aybubu asked the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 20,000 Kyrgyzstani Somoni to buy calves. With the income from the loan Aybubu plans to further increase her number of livestock, and intends to finish the house in which she lives with her family.

loans.use: to buy gobies

loans.name: Salem

texts.en: Salem is 20 years old. He lives in Mafraq, Jordan, with his family, which consists of ten family members. He is studying for a Bachelor of Computer Information Systems degree, in his second year. Salem is planning to expand his study to get a Master's degree in the future. As he is facing financial crisis, he is requesting a loan to be able to pay his study fees.

loans.use: to pay for his study fees.

loans.name: Vianney

texts.en:
Vianney is 33 years old. He is a father of two children. He has been a rice farmer for the past 25 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to upgrade the farming method he has been using. He would like to see himself in an extensive mode of farming in the future.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 27-year-old single man and has been the owner of an internet cafe for four years, with five years of experience in this field.  

Most of Mohamad's clients are his fellow villagers who enjoy spending their time in his shop since he is almost the same age and holds competitions on a certain game, which increases enthusiasm among them. In addition, small children also come to play games suitable for their ages, which he recommends.  

Because such a business recommends a lot of new releases, Mohamad is requesting a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a new extra PlayStation with its necessary accessories and requested games to keep his customers pleased and to satisfy their needs. This is Mohamad's third loan from Al Majmoua, and through his previous loan, he bought a new PlayStation, an LCD screen and a power generator to make sure that electricity is available all the time for his customers' benefit.  

He hopes to keep expanding his business through establishing several departments, each one targeting a certain age and needs, and he is doing just that, but gradually through Al Majmoua loans.

loans.use: to buy a new PlayStation with its necessary accessories and requested games.

loans.name: Liszy Estefani

texts.es:
Liszy Estefani  es una mujer de 19 años emprendedora, luchadora, con ganas de salir adelante  quien desde  muy pequeña tiene la expectativa  de estudiar alguna carrera relacionada con la salud porque siempre le ha gustado ayudar a los demás y  siente que es su vocación.  En el 2012 se graduó de bachillerato y  no pudo ingresar a estudiar Medicina puesto que no tenía  los recursos necesarios para conseguir todo el dinero que se necesita, entonces quiso estudiar enfermería y escogió Campo alto porque le pareció un excelente lugar; pero no logró inscribirse en el primer semestre porque no tenía la plata de la matrícula, ni de la pensión, además  no tenía quien cuidara de su hija de 18 meses  mientras ella estudiaba, por ello no pudo trabajar y no tiene los recursos suficientes para pagar su carrera ; mientras tanto sus padres y su novio le ayudan con los gastos;  por otro lado su mamá trabaja por días y hace lo posible para ahorrar y conseguir el dinero para que su hija Liszy pueda cumplir su sueño.
Liszy quiere ser alguien en la vida, quiere salir adelante y sacar adelante a su hija y  que  ella se sienta  orgullosa de su madre…
texts.en:
Liszy Estefani is a 19-year-old woman who is enterprising, determined, and has the drive to succeed. From a very young age, she expected to study for some type of degree related to health because she enjoyed helping others and felt like that was her calling. In 2012, she graduated from high school but was not able to enter a degree plan in medicine because she did not have the necessary resources to continue. Liszy then chose to study nursing and selected CampoAlto because it appeared to be a great place. She was not able to enroll for the first semester because she did not have the money for registration or room and board. In addition, she was not able to care for her 18-month-old daughter while studying. This also explains why she is not able to work and does not have sufficient resources to pay for her degree. In the meantime, her parents and her boyfriend are helping with the expenses. Her mother works for days in order to save and provide money for Liszy so that she can fulfill her dream.

Liszy wants to be someone in life who can get ahead and help her daughter move forward. This makes her proud to be a mother.

loans.use: to pay for her studies at CampoAlto.

loans.name: Jenny Marcela

texts.es: Cuenta la historia que Marcela era una joven que buscaba un mejor futuro y bienestar para ella y su familia pero las oportunidades que se le presentaban eran bastantes limitadas, en cada proyecto que tenía se le  presentaban obstáculos,  pero ella seguía luchando para alcanzar sus propósitos, su proyecto de vida se fundamentaba básicamente en tener un título profesional pero debido a los costos lo veía un poco difícil, cierto día paso por una entidad muy reconocida, se detuvo a mirar los programas que ofrecía y le llamo la atención que estaba el que ella le gustaba, no lo dudó ni un instante en entrar y preguntar cómo podía obtener que su proyecto de vida se hiciera realidad, le ofrecieron varias alternativas entre ellas poder contar con el apoyo del kiva, la atendieron amablemente y la escucharon sin ser interrumpida; hoy en día es una persona  que está sacando su proyecto adelante y puede decir con seguridad que podrá ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Marcela’s story is that of a young woman who is seeking to have a better future and to provide for her own well-being and that of her family. However, the opportunities that have been presented to her were limited. Each option had its own obstacles, but she continued to press forward so that she could reach her goals. Her main goal in life is to have a professional degree, but the cost of obtaining one was a bit difficult. One day she passed by a well-known institution and took the time to look over the programs that were being offered. When she was drawn to a program that she liked, Marcela instantly jumped at the opportunity and began asking questions about how she could make this goal in life a reality. Among the various alternatives that were offered to her was the chance to apply for a Kiva loan. Marcela was kindly attended to and someone listened to her without interruption.

Today she is moving forward with her goals and can say with confidence that she will be able to provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her studies at CampoAlto.

loans.name: Fakhra's Group

texts.en: Fakhra is a housewife and a group leader of this two-person lending group. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her family. She belongs to a poor family. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's general store. Currently the stock of the general store is almost depleted. Therefore, he wants to purchase a variety of products for his store including flour, pulses, soap, detergents, etc., so that he can continue his work. He wants to add more variety to his store to attract more customers. Fakhra will save the profits to meet the household's daily expenses. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her family. She lives in a poor community where they must face a lot of issues and challenges. One of the main issues is the lack of clean water. She wishes to live in a clean and hygenic community. She is feeling very happy and relaxed after receiving the loan amount.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products for her husband's store including flour, pulses, soap, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 33 years old. He is married with five children. He has been a rice farmer for the past eight years. He has requested a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production. The profits from rice production will be used to maintain the family's basic needs.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice productions.

loans.name: Zulkhumor

texts.ru: Зулхумор 40-летняя замужняя женщина, проживающая в городе Истаравшан на севере Таджикистана. У нее двое детей. Старший сын студент, а младшая дочь ученица средней школы. Муж Зулхумор работает мигрантом в загранице. Зулхумор собирается начать торговый бизнес. Она на свои сбережения построила помещение для магазина, а также закупила телевизор, DVD устройство, колонки и ноутбук. Зулхумор хочет начать бизнес по продаже музыкальных дисков, видео дисков и т.д. Она уже обустроила свой магазин и теперь осталось только закупить диски и начать продажу. Чтобы реализовать свою цель она обратилась за кредитом в размере 1000 долларов США для покупки ассортимента видео и аудио дисков. Ей в бизнесе будет помогать сын. Она верит, что ее бизнес будет пользоваться успехом и будет приносить ей хороший доход.
texts.en:
Zulkhumor is a 40 year old married woman who lives in Istaravshan, a city in the north of Tajikistan.  She has two children.  The the oldest is her son and the youngest is her daughter who is in high school.  Zulkhumor's husband works abroad as an emigrant laborer.  Zulkhumor is getting ready to start a sales business.  Using her own savings, she built a building for the store, bought a television, DVD player, speakers, and a laptop.  

Zulkhumor wants to start a business selling CDs, DVDs, etc.  She has already fitted out her store and now all that's left to do is to buy the disks and start selling.  In order to reach her goal, she applied for a loan of $1,000 (USD) to buy an assortment of audio and video disks.  Her son will help her with the business.  Zulkhumor believes that her business will be successful and will bring her a good income.

loans.use: to buy audio and video disks for opening her store

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 22-year-old, single, Lebanese man.  He lives with his parents and his only sibling, who works in the Lebanese army.  The family members cooperate to earn a sufficient income to satisfy their needs.  Since a couple of years ago, Ali owns a shop selling computers and different related accessories.  

In order to strengthen his business operations, Ali is looking to borrow a youth loan from Vitas s.a.l.  He will buy computers and related items with the aim of enhancing his repair services to satisfying his customer’s demands.  In that way, he will increase his income by a hefty percentage.  In the future, he plans to expand his business and engage with the networking job.

loans.use: to purchase computers and related items.

loans.name: Khurshida

texts.ru: Хуршеда молодая и умная девушка. Ей 18 лет. Она не замужем. Хуршеда c отличными оценками окончила среднюю школу. Она успешно поступила в Педагогический Университет Таджикистана в факультет Русская филология. Она добросовестная и трудолюбивая девушка, и поэтому ее родители гордятся ею. В свободное время она помогает маме по домохозяйству и читает книги. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор в университете, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Khurshida is a smart young woman.  She is 18 years old and not married.  She finished high school with only the best grades and she was accepted to the Pedagogic University of Tajikistan’s department of Russian philology.  She is a conscientious and hardworking young woman and her parents are very proud of her because of this.  In her free time, she helps her mother around the house and reads.  She has to pay her university tuition, but has no money.  She is requesting a loan to pay the tuition.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition

loans.name: Idi

texts.en: Idi is a 30-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of three children. He deals in selling shoes and has been in business for five years. His business is located on the market street where the public can access him. He has hopes of expanding his business into bigger markets despite challenges of stiff competition and the seasonal nature of the business. Idi is requesting a loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Phuong
